intro: Diodella teres, commonly known as the narrow-leafed diodella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically includes plants with medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that are often yellow or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
